name: Fingerstring Reminders
description: Sets and manages reminders for a user. Accepts a natural language description of what to remember and when, and delivers the reminder at the specified time via webhook, email, or SMS. Supports one-time and recurring reminders. Can list, update, or cancel existing reminders. Think of it as tying a string around your finger â€” but it actually works.

input.description: JSON object with 'action' (set, list, cancel, update), 'reminder' (natural language description), 'when' (natural language time like 'tomorrow at 9am', 'every Monday', 'in 30 minutes'), and optional 'deliver_via' (webhook, email, sms).

output.description: JSON object with 'id' (reminder ID), 'status' (scheduled, cancelled, delivered), 'next_delivery' (ISO 8601 timestamp), and 'reminder' (confirmed text).

examples.description: Set a recurring reminder with webhook delivery
